item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, February 17, 2025 at 8:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. All Kindles can now be jailbroken (376 points | 139 comments)
2. Homemade polarimetric synthetic aperture radar drone (280 points | 23 comments)
3. Word embeddings – Part 3: The secret ingredients of Word2Vec (38 points | 5 comments)
4. Uchū – Color palette for internet lovers (430 points | 170 comments)
5. How do modern compilers choose which variables to put in registers? (77 points | 8 comments)
6. San Francisco homelessness: Park ranger helps one person at a time (172 points | 243 comments)
7. Anno 1800: Shadows of Beauty (72 points | 6 comments)
8. I pulled data on 1378 restaurants from Google Maps to rank them in order (46 points | 21 comments)
9. Does or did COBOL default to 1875-05-20 for corrupt or missing dates? (114 points | 164 comments)
10. MySQL at Uber (63 points | 17 comments)
11. Flea-Scope: $18 Source Available USB Oscilloscope, Logic Analyzer and More [pdf] (289 points | 92 comments)
12. “A calculator app? Anyone could make that” (1459 points | 352 comments)
13. Hans Bethe Stumbled Upon Perfect Quantum Theories (11 points | discuss)
14. IPv6 Is Hard (164 points | 257 comments)
15. My Time at MIT (13 points | 1 comment)
16. Extreme supersonic winds measured on a planet outside our solar system (31 points | 9 comments)
17. Opposing arrows of time can theoretically emerge from certain quantum systems (62 points | 67 comments)
18. Show HN: Air traffic control radio and chill music for focus (163 points | 87 comments)
19. Ugandan runner Jacob Kiplimo completes first ever sub-57 minute half marathon (91 points | 37 comments)
20. The deadly lottery of the snakebite antivenom industry (8 points | 1 comment)
21. Gold Is Worth More in New York (69 points | 70 comments)
22. Explaining my fast 6502 code generator (2023) (81 points | 16 comments)
23. YouTube asks channel owner to verify phone, permanently overwrites personal info (204 points | 138 comments)
24. Javier Milei backtracks on $4.4B memecoin after 'insiders' pocket $87M (166 points | 176 comments)
25. When Not to Obey Orders (2019) (78 points | 19 comments)
26. Physics Informed Neural Networks (30 points | 1 comment)
27. Half-Life 2 and Dishonored art lead Viktor Antonov has died (453 points | 89 comments)
28. Publish Your Gaussian Splats with SuperSplat (35 points | 4 comments)
29. Did the Windows 95 setup team forget that MS-DOS can do graphics? (88 points | 30 comments)
30. OpenVINO AI effects [denoising and transcription] for Audacity (125 points | 24 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, February 17, 2025 at 8:20 AM UTC
